healthy.description: Your plant appears to be healthy with no visible signs of disease!
healthy.treatment: Continue providing optimal care conditions for your plant.
healthy.prevention: Maintain consistent watering, proper sunlight exposure, and balanced fertilization to keep your plant healthy.
tips: Water when the top 2-3 inches of soil feel dry
Provide 6-8 hours of indirect sunlight daily
Use balanced fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during growing season

bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial spot disease causes small, dark, water-soaked spots on leaves that may have a yellow halo.
bacterial_spot.treatment: Remove and destroy affected leaves immediately. Apply copper-based bactericide spray every 7-10 days.
bacterial_spot.prevention: Avoid overhead watering to prevent water from sitting on leaves. Ensure good air circulation around plants.
tips: Space plants properly to allow air movement
Water at soil level, not on leaves
Clean tools between plants to prevent spread
Apply preventive copper spray during wet seasons

early_blight.description: Early blight appears as dark spots with concentric rings, typically starting on older leaves.
early_blight.treatment: Remove affected leaves and apply fungicide containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Improve air circulation.
early_blight.prevention: Mulch around plants to prevent soil splash. Rotate crops and avoid planting in same location year after year.
tips: Apply fungicide preventively during humid conditions
Remove plant debris from garden beds
Water early in the day to allow leaves to dry quickly
Stake plants to improve air circulation

late_blight.description: Late blight causes large, dark, water-soaked lesions that spread rapidly, especially in cool, wet conditions.
late_blight.treatment: Remove and destroy affected plants immediately. Apply fungicide containing mefenoxam or phosphorous acid.
late_blight.prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Avoid working with plants when they are wet. Improve drainage in planting areas.
tips: Monitor weather forecasts and apply preventive sprays before rain
Remove volunteer plants from previous seasons
Use drip irrigation instead of overhead watering
Apply fungicide at first sign of disease and repeat every 7-10 days
